text: you've probably never thought about
adding beats to a pasta sauce but let me
tell you it's great because not only are
beets in season right now they just add
a sweet earthiness to pasta especially
when you top it with brown butter I'm
also gonna add fresh ricotta I've got a
cup and a half in the bowl here and I'm
gonna season it with some orange zest
about 1/4 teaspoon or so do it to taste
some people have a higher tolerance for
orange zest and others and I have some
chopped sage basil is really nice here
too and then salt and pepper just a
little bit to season this is gonna get
dollop all over the top if you're making
the ricotta right before you're gonna
cook the beets you can just leave it out
at room temperature it'll be fine for
about an hour or so but if it's any more
than that put it in the fridge it'll
keep better and now I'm gonna make my
brown butter into this very hot pan I'm
gonna add butter very hot pan did I
mention that and I'm just gonna let this
melt over medium-high heat until the
milk solids which are those little foamy
white bits fall to the bottom and then
they're gonna get caramelized and golden
brown
that's what brown butter is it's
basically browning those little milk
solids and what happens is the butter
takes on this lovely nutty gently sweet
taste which is just wonderful anywhere
you want to use butter you could
probably use brown butter and it'll be
delicious it's gonna take about five
minutes up okay this is nice and golden
brown little flecks on the bottom and
I'm gonna add the beets and I'm gonna
cook these grated beets directly in the
brown butter I'm gonna cover the pan and
just let them sit for about 10 or 15
minutes until they're very very soft you
should be done I'm just gonna season
them with a little bit of salt and then
to cut their sweetness I've got some
vinegar a little bit of pepper too and
here I have cavatelli freshly cooked I'm
gonna add a little bit of the pasta
cooking water back in this is gonna help
moisten everything and I've got a little
bit of butter Parmesan cheese and as
soon as the cheese melts that's what I'm
gonna add the
it's kinda better now I cooked my
cavatelli in very salted water heavily
salted so I don't have to add any salt
right now you always want to do that
because it seasons the noodle all the
way through and now the beets go right
into the bowl you can see that they've
absorbed most of that brown butter and
then when I toss it the whole entire
bowl is gonna turn pink so just give a
taste just to make sure that the vinegar
is right it's alright hmm one more salt
to garnish this I'm gonna add some of
that ricotta that we made I'm gonna put
it in small dollops kind of all over you
could put it in one large dollop in the
center if you like and pistachios really
for their beautiful green color you
could use any nuts but you want to use
some kind of nut because you want the
crunch and you also want to underscore
that brown butter flavor that nuttiness
pasta with beet sauce yeah can't beat it
okay that was bad it's not your typical
red sauce
it's a pink sauce it's
